chapter.title: Initial setup
chapter.para: In the following steps replace arachne.example.com with your arachne server's full qualified domain name.

listitem.para: Start Tomcat server
Open arachne in Mozilla Firefox or in your favorite web browser.
You will see arachne's setup wizard
Enjoy arachne setup wizard's welcome page
Set name of master adminitrative user and password.
Create a self signed CA, that will create certificates for the openvpn server and VPN users.

screenshot.screeninfo: Setup wizard - create self signed CA

listitem.para: Create openvpn server certificate. The common name must be the full qualified domain name (FQDN) of your openvpn server as visible from the internet.
Arachne stores its settings and certificate in a postgresql database. Set username etc. here.

screenshot.screeninfo: Setup wizard - create self signed CA

listitem.para: You can download a SQL file that contains everything to create a database user and an empty database. A hash of the password you entered here is also included.
To enable md5 authentication on your postgres server, add the following line to /var/lib/pgsql/data/pg_hba.conf:
To appay changes in /var/lib/pgsql/data/pg_hba.conf restart postgres server
You can test the database connectivity by clicking Test connection.
To finalize setup click "finish" on the last page. Arachne will create the administrator user, your CA, a server certificate, DH paramers and all neccasary database tables and initial values.
This step takes a couple of minutes.
When the login screen appears enter username and passwd for the user you've just created.

section.title: Roles
section.para: There are two roles: admin and user. An admin can modify any settings, an user is allowed to connect via openvpn. A user can have both roles.

section.title: Authentication by remote user with Kerberos
section.para:
The following examplme describes how to setup Apache HTTP server on CentOS assuming the host is member of a
FreeIPA domain. Microsoft ActiveDirectory may also work, the way howto get the keytab and SSL certificate is different. Other authentication mechanisms like SAML may also work.
Apache HTTP server and Tomcat are connected with AJP. AJP is a binary protocol that can proxy inbound requests from a web server through to an application server that sits behind the web server.
We assume, that server's FQDN is openvpn.example.com.

listitem.para: Configure Apache
Install packages
listitem.programlisting: sudo yum install httpd mod_nss mod_auth_kerb

listitem.para: Copy sample configuration to HTTP configuration folder
Create service on FreeIPA server and install keytab
listitem.programlisting: ipa service-add HTTP/$HOSTNAME ipa-getkeytab -k /tmp/httpd.keytab -p HTTP/$HOSTNAME sudo mv -v /tmp/httpd.keytab /etc/httpd/krb5.keytab sudo chown -v apache /etc/httpd/krb5.keytab

listitem.para: Create and install SSL certificate
listitem.programlisting: sudo certutil -d /etc/httpd/alias/ -D -n Server-Cert sudo ipa-getcert request -d /etc/httpd/alias/ -n Server-Cert -K HTTP/$HOSTNAME -N "CN=$HOSTNAME" sudo getcert resubmit -n Server-Cert -d /etc/httpd/alias/

listitem.para: Make HTTPD server listen on port 443 enstead of 8443.
Restore selinux context
Restart and enable HTTP server
listitem.programlisting: sudo systemctl start httpd sudo systemctl enable httpd

listitem.para: Configure Tomcat
Disable authentication in Tomcat. If authenticatian is enabled - which is the default -, Tomcat will ignore the remote user supplied by Apache.
listitem.programlisting: sudo sed -i \ 's/Connector port="8009" protocol="AJP\\/1.3"/\Connector port="8009" protocol="AJP\\/1.3" tomcatAuthentication="false"/' \ /etc/tomcat/server.xml

chapter.title: Get client configuration
chapter.para:
Arachne provides two types of client configuration:
classic openVPN configuration file (.pvpn)
Shell script that adds or modifies a NetworkManager configuration
Both configuration types can be retrieved in several ways. To add a configuration to NetworkManager save the file, make it executable und execute it.

section.title: Download from administration page
section.para:
A user with admin role can download client configurations for any user.
Login as user with role admin and navigate to View/Edit users
Find the user you want to download the configuration for
Click Actions and select the prefered download option

section.title: Download from user welcopme page
section.para:
A user without admin role can download his/her personal from user welcome page.
Login as user wuth user role
Click on the crow web to download tzhe NetworkManager installer or on the openVPN icon to download .ovpn file

section.title: Direct download from download URL
section.para:
A user with user role can download his/her personal configuration direct from download url.
NetworkManager installer: http(s)://arachne.example.com:8080/arachne/download/add-vpn-to-networkmanager.sh
.ovpn file: http(s)://arachne.example.com:8080/arachne/download/client-config.ovpn
